intro: Phlomoides molucelloides, commonly known as the Moluccan phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pale blue to violet flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
